div.p: The Daily Activities for Your Brain (DAB) site is CSDNB's online learning resource center. Visit here for grade-appropriate activities, instructions for navigating on-line learning, connections to CSDNB staff, virtual field trips, and more!

a.span:
CLICK HERE TO ENTER
THE ACADEMICS DAB SITE

div.p: Every student's online classes are in Google Classroom! Enter your online classroom to communicate with your teacher and access and turn in assignments. Be sure to check in every day, because Every Day (Still) Matters!

Click below for a How-To Guide to Google Classroom:
On YouTube: Google Classroom How-To Guide
On Google Slides: Google Classroom How-To Guide

td.style: width:70.777988614801%; padding:0 15px; color: #FFF; text-align: justify; font-size: 14px; font-family: Arial;

div.div:
Latest Messages Regarding Coronavirus
In an effort to keep everyone connected and informed, Superintendent Nancy Sarra will continue to share frequent updates and messages with students, families, and staff.
April 28nd, 2020, Volunteers rallied on behalf of health care workers and first responders in our community over the past two weeks, accomplishing their mission to produce approximately 22,000 protective face shields for donation through a collaborative project between CSDNB, OKAY Industries, and the Community Foundation of Greater New Britain (CFGNB).
Click here to read more
April 27th, 2020, Registration is open to receive access to virtual Play-and-Learns and Family Support Groups. Both programs are led by certified parent educators and are designed for families with children ages 0 through 5. Participants will be connected with resources in the school and community that support child development.
Click here to read more and to register
Please visit the link below for up-to-date information and ongoing communication from CSDNB regarding Coronavirus or COVID-19. We are following the advice of government agencies at the local, state, and national levels.
Click here to Visit Coronavirus Update Page

p.span: Meal Distribution Sites at Eight Locations During School Closure

th.p: CSDNB and Whitson's Culinary Group has Meal Distribution Sites set up in eight locations throughout New Britain to help ensure that all children ages 18 and younger have access to breakfast and lunch during the school closure due to the Coronavirus or COVID-19. They include New Britain High School, Smalley Elementary, Smith Elementary, Pulaski Middle School, Lincoln Elementary School, DiLoreto Elementary & Middle School, and the Boys and Girls Club. Beginning April 13, an eighth site at Jefferson Elementary School will also open. The hours are Monday-Friday from 8:30 am-10:00 am and from 11:30 am-1:00 pm. You may pick up both breakfast and lunch with one stop. They will also expand food services to include additional sites and efforts.

div.strong: In partnership with family and community, the Consolidated School District of New Britain works to provide the best personalized and comprehensive whole-child education at every level so students will be prepared for, and positively contribute to, a profoundly different future. The Consolidated School District of New Britain strives to pursue excellence one student a time.
